review: wonderful game with wonderful story
putin

its still a superb game but i guess im not seeing why most people prefer it to the original syberia the story worldbuilding and characters all shine but some of the puzzles are unnecessarily difficult and theres a fair amount of backtracking that gets tedious at times more so than in the first game these are nitpicks however because the syberia series still towers high in the world of adventure games
this game is very good pristine nice gameplay the graphics are very nostalgic 1010 really recommend
a relaxing puzzle game about breaking free of convention and following your dreams no matter where they lead

very similar to the original clunky and old but i enjoyed it even still in the 2020s the way that the natives are treated remains a bit problematic in my opinion but other than that it holds up pretty well
straight up 1010 is all i will say

my play time was 10 hours  many puzzles required me to check walkthroughs as they were impossible  i still recommend this game as it is hard to find nonviolent non pixel graphics  point and click adventure games these days   of syberia games the world before is my favorite then syberia 1  this comes in 3rd of those three games  the art work is beautiful the story was good   you can double click to make kate run and you can right click to fast forward thru dialogue

very good story telling and interesting story about mysterious syberia controls and animations little odd and time to time little annoying but this game released 2004 so thats good for its time anyone who likes point and click games with a good story should play this game
good sequel 810
cool story  trilogy
i grew up playing this game i will never ever lose my love for it the simplicity the nostalgia the fantastic storyline  its all just perfect
finished this part right after syberia thank you again for a great story to catch up finally kate arrived to syberia

so far so good a lot of the issues that plagued the first game were fixed  theres a directional arrow pointing to each area you can move to so its easier to map out the different locations  the dialogues now get removed as you go through them so you dont end up in an infinite repetition loop
one of the classic pointandclicks compared to the first part of the series the graphics have not changed so much but compared to the third  the second is inferior but it is understandable  2004
i played the game ages ago same as its predecessor one of the best games of all time for me amazing and way ahead of its time magnificent like every other benot sokal work

love this series so far exquisite artwork and captivating story the slow animations has been reduced to a great degree as well my only complaint is the constant perspective changes from scene to scene one scene youre running from left to right next scene right to left and you end up running back to where you just exited
it is old but gold it is sometimes a bit clunky and gives you very little indication on clues and is easy to miss what the next step should be but the art and story are both charming

slow pace repetitive and long answers from npcs and the order in which you choose your interactions can spoil the solutions makes the conversations quite absurd starting with the npc giving you the nature and location of your next objective that you didnt know of and ending with you asking if they could help you other times you just have no clue what to do and the game doesnt really help you but at least it was funny plus youkiiii
amazing
continuo a nao gostar de zonas frias
excellent continuation of the first story cant wait to play the final game in this trilogy
epic sequel
best adventure sequence the characters were also improved
awesome sequel to a great game that delivers on its promises the story is concluded even if some things are not really cleared up the ending is just beautiful really great experience
nice and relaxing 2
story sucks dialogue cut off some of it seems written by 3 year olds while other dialogue seems to have been written by scientists could not get into this game no sure why its so positive reviewed
of course a must for all syberia fans  the story is kind of touching the playtime is longer and there are few puzzles instead of only finding a way like its prequel so it is a plus
great game great music great cinematics
not as good as the first one but the visuals are still stunning and the story is good some of the puzzles especially in the later game are only solvable via walkthru or trialanderror
nice story  take u to ice age syberia near to mammoths played after many years
oldie but a goodie point click and chill

i didnt really like this one as much as the first one i feel like the characterization of kate changed too much among some other issues its still worth a play to continue the story but not necessarily a great game in its own right even so i still plan to play the rest of the series

we continue our journey in search of syberia with hans right where we left the first game   in my opinion the first installment was more nostalgic probably because valadilene just really hit the spot for me its the best location so far  but anyway its definitely worth playing the second game aswell puzzles maybe a tad harder but it can be done and the story is still well executed
beautiful end for the beautiful story
fun
exciting challenging

syberia ii picks up where the first game left off for you to continue the story and its just as good as the first played both games with my mum growing up and its very nostalgic for me to replay them fun new and old characters and puzzles its not quite as obvious who you need to speak to about what and what to do with items in some puzzles but its still a very interesting game
syberia is my childhood game 2 is just as good and very happy to see it on steam i love to come back to it once every few years
this and the first game are a pair i enjoyed the games back to back

im not saying its the best way to send off an ailing loved one but packing an old man into the robotic corpse of a friend and sending him unattended with a pack feral pachyderms definitely ranks among the top 10 palliative care best practices
soo good and storyline great along with first game
fr
better then the first

i mean lets be honest for me it didnt have exactly the same charm as the first i did love the story continuation of the first that was exciting the art was still great even though the graphics itself in my opinion didnt really take a step up from the first in any way  i just often found myself frustrated with some of the bugs and trying to click on things overall if you loved the first syberia you will love this one
good sequel story is well written fun puzzles and good upgrade of visuals
another great classic adventure with great story 2

not a game meant to be played on its own since this picks up right were syberia left off it has the same exact gameplay and mechanics so is pretty seamless the question is did you enjoy the first game enough to finish the story

pretty good sequel of the first game sometimes the dialog got cut due to it being an old game but it runs fine in my computer
good story but it did not age well  also i loved syberia 1 because we visited so many locations and saw lots of people  second part was not that diverse
hans hugging the trunk was worth all of it

finished this game some ago but decided to add review now worthy continuation from game 1  still beautiful story beautiful world design and ending worth all hours spent on playing cannot recommend enough
lovely pointandclick adventure story great followup of the first syberia game

after this sentence this review is identical to my syberia 1 review rather obscure puzzles at times but the story is nice need gfx fix for high res play but thats easy done got it on a sale and im glad i did because 3 and the world before are baaad the former being impossibly clunky and the latter being straight up woke trash as another reviewer put it

one of the best stories of point  click adventure games puzzles are a bit more complicated than in the first game tho the game itself was a bit shorter definitely worth playing just for the story itself the only problem i had playing it on win 11 was that sometimes the audio of kates lines were cut right before she finishes her sentence

i recommend it its the natural and final conclusion of the first game you should try the first one though the emotional and historical settings of the first game are very good and interesting plus if you like art drawing and artnouveau the first game is a must this second game has a lot more puzzles note tweak both games graphics settings to adapt to the current 1080p and 1440p monitors lots of help around forums and the web to help you do that
